sktemplate.name: Fido screen authentication - meirav

customHTML.value:
<!-- Check whether the end-user browser is supporting WebAuthn to understand if security keys and platform biomentic method are usable -->
<form id="webAuthenSupportForm" method="post">
    <input type="hidden" name="webAuthenSupport" id="webAuthenSupport">
    <button type="hidden" data-skcomponent="skbutton" data-skbuttontype="form-submit" class="hidden-button"  data-skbuttonvalue="submit" data-skform="webAuthenSupportForm" id="autoSubmit">Next</button>
</form>

Success

Thank you for trying Ping

annotation.value: Lookup user in PingOne and check Password
Common Error - Message passed in thru teleport
Set the Assertion, based on Device type in JS

Pre-Requisites: In order for this flow to work, you need to configure the PingOne MFA Connector, configure the PingOne Risk Connector, and populate the PingOneRiskPolicy variable in the flow’s first variables connector
To simulate LOW/MEDIUM/HIGH risk responses use the whitelist override in the PingOne Risk policy to set your IP address as a decision for a risk score.
Master flow check user and password
Finish MFA for OTP and FIDO
Type of MFA - OTP or FIDO2
Message  - Not Implemented and Integration Directory Link

customHTML.value:
Not Implemented

These are Implemented in this flow, please look in the Integration Directory for Subflows to complete this flow

Ping Integration Directory

annotation.value: Get all Devices from PingOne for PingOne MFA
Teleport to Risk - Sending UserID from PingOne
Create Risk score and check for Result
Call PingOne Risk to update Risk Score
Success with Low and Medium Risk
Checking for FIDO Device in JS
Check for FIDO (assertion) or OTP or Single Device
Go to DeviceDetails and pass deviceType
Go to DeviceDetails and pass deviceType
Go to DeviceDetails and pass deviceType

<!-- Check whether the end-user browser is supporting WebAuthn to understand if security keys and platform biomentic method are usable -->
<form id="webAuthenSupportForm" method="post">
    <input type="hidden" name="webAuthenSupport" id="webAuthenSupport">
    <button type="hidden" data-skcomponent="skbutton" data-skbuttontype="form-submit" class="hidden-button"  data-skbuttonvalue="submit" data-skform="webAuthenSupportForm" id="autoSubmit">Next</button>
</form>
